thread.title: Red Shirts leader detained over theft at entertainment outlet
thread.title_full: Red Shirts leader detained over theft at entertainment outlet

author: FARIK ZOLKEPLI, D.KANYAKUMARI and DINA MURAD
title: Red Shirts leader detained over theft at entertainment outlet
text:
by farik zolkepli , d.kanyakumari , and dina murad 
KUALA LUMPUR: Red Shirts leader Datuk Seri Jamal Yunos will be remanded today to help the police investigate an alleged theft at an entertainment outlet, which his group “raided” in December. 
Police arrested Jamal yesterday while nine of his friends were arrested on Wednesday night, said Selangor CID chief Senior Asst Comm Fadzil Ahmat. 
“They were detained to assist investigations into a theft that took place at an entertainment outlet in Ampang, one of several establishments, which the group had raided,” SAC Fadzil said. 
One of the owner of the premises claimed that several items went missing after Jamal had raided the outlet, he added. 
SAC Fadzil said Jamal and his friends were being investigated under Section 395 of the Penal Code. 
The section deals with punishment for gang-robbery and states that whoever commits the crime faces a maximum 20 years’ jail and whipping. 
He said the police would seek a remand order for Jamal today while his friends had been remanded. 
“To make it clear, Jamal did not raid illegal gambling dens. The premises were entertainment outlets,” SAC Fadzil said. 
Plain-clothes police turned up and surrounded Jamal’s home in Ampang at 12.30pm yesterday. 
Speaking to The Star from inside his home, Jamal, who is also Sungai Besar Umno chief, claimed that he had informed the police that he would turn up at the Ampang police station at 3pm. 
“So I really do not know why so many of them are here in front of my house. Maybe they do not want me to speak to the press. 
“I really am not sure, but that is the only explanation I can find. 
“I am prepared to be held and arrested as long as the issue at hand, which is illegal gambling, is addressed,” he said. 
Jamal finally came out of his house at 3pm, waving to a crowd of curious onlookers including his neighbours. 
He was then taken to a police car and driven to the Ampang police station.
